results.title: Ivan Durrant (D)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Australian artist Ivan Durrant is infamously known for killing a cow and depositing it at the entrance of the National Gallery of Victoria in the late 60’s. It was to accompany another of his well-known art pieces, “The Butcher Shop”, housed at the gallery in their permanent collection. One of Australia’s most accomplished photo-realist artists, Durrant’s paintings are featured alongside his sculptural works in this documentary. His subjects stem from childhood memories and mostly centre around images of cattle and pigs, with man’s violence against animals featuring in more esoteric ways in works like, “the quality meat show”. Looking broadly, his work is preoccupied with perception and how we choose to box or see things, or refuse to consider the more difficult truths about ourselves. Contained within this video are some images of cruelty against animals, with excerpts from Durrant’s film “Chopping Blocks” that is particularly disturbing in content. Please note: both U-matic and VHS copy have poor quality sound.

results.title: Hotham holiday
results.brief_description: Shows Mount Hotham, Victoria as a holiday getaway - the snow fields, ski-runs; the trip from Harrietville 12 miles away; people riding horses to reach the snowline; beautiful views and natural environment. Hotham Heights is the highest meteorological station in Australia. This film was made pre “chairlifts”.

results.title: Wildflower Wonderland
results.brief_description: Informational travelogue on the Grampians National Park focussing mainly on the diversity of flora in and around the area and interspersed with scenes of people bushwalking some of the well-known tracks available.

results.title: Wine service: a guide for professional waiters
results.creator_credit: Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Produced by the Australian Wine Board, this work features the skills and knowledge required for wine waiting. A short instructional film, it aims to assist in making the right selection of wine varieties to match with food, relying on the knowledge of the restaurant staff. Get the insider knowledge from inside the waiters’ pantry: “it’s important you have a sound knowledge of your foods, and more particularly of your wines”.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions

results.title: Coal
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
Elementary account of Australia’s coal industry showing models of coal formations; the principal coal mining areas of Australia; views of Wollongong, Newcastle and Lithgow, centres of coal mining areas; open cut mining at Musellbrook; the uses to which coal is put and some of its principal by-products.

results.title: Make the Most of Your Roast
results.creator_credit: Meat and Livestock Australia and Robert Knapp
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Meat makes the meal”.
Produced for the Australian Meat Board, this film demonstrates clearly and simply the steps essential in making a good roast. Tips such as keeping the oven temperature low, placing the meat on a grill and using a meat thermometer are explained and demonstrated.
